result.execSummary:
The defendant Chance P. Poling was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Non-Narcotics [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment, sexual assault victimization treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  Obtain GED or H.S.E.D. during term of probation.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Spend 12 months in the county jail w/huber privileges - Stayed.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

timeConds.notes: AS A CONDITION OF PROBATION court imposes 180 days KCJ with credit since 2/3/16.  Huber is allowed for employment and treatment upon completion of the Living Free Program.

NO RECORD MADE.  State appeared by Special Prosecutor Thaddeus McGuire  No appearance by the Defendant.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Issue of outstanding court costs.  Costs have been paid in full, no action taken.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Issue of outstanding court costs.  Deft states he believes he will have the balance of supervision fees paid prior to his discharge date.  PRH continued to 6/6/17 at 8:15am; civil judgment to be entered on any amount remaining at that time; deft does not need to appear.
Probation review hearing on May 5, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 18 months w/conditions; 1 year conditional jail is stayed, Huber allowed; pay $250 DNA surcharge.  Expunction hearing set for 7/5/17 at 8:30am.
With Atty Watson the SEH of 11/9/15 at 9am is rescheduled, as she just has not had time to review the PSI with the deft; reset to 12/2/15 at 9am.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, ct 2 is dismissed and read in.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  Firearms warning given.  SEH 11/9/15 at 9am.  Bond continued.
